intro: Pavetta timorensis, commonly known as the Timor pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a small shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Pavetta timorensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
